rrpss

Class TableManager

  • Object
    • TableManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class TableManager
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Manages the Table of the Restaurant by providing getters of the list of tables and individual table, various methods to add new table, remove existing table, and allocate table for an order.
    Author:
    Kenrick
    See Also:
    Serializable, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int numTables
      Number of tables, which is equal to the size of tables vector.
      private Vector<Table> tables
      List of tables, implemented in Vector data structure.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TableManager()
      Constructs an TableManager object and initialize the attributes tables to empty and numTables to zero.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTable(int capacity)
      Adds a table to the vector with given capacity.
      Table allocateTable(int numPerson)
      Returns a Table object that satistifies the number of person and the availability of the table.
      Table getTableById(int id)
      Using table id (table number) to retreive a single Table object from the manager.
      Vector<Table> getTables()
      Returns list of tables in Vector data structure
      void removeTable(int id)
      Using table id (table number) to select a table by its id and remove it from the table list (tables)
      private void sortTable()
      Sorts the entries inside tables by capacity using Collections.sort by implementing Comparable class in Table class and having a compareTo method inside Table class.

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • tables

        private Vector<Table> tables
        List of tables, implemented in Vector data structure. Each entry consists of a reference to existing Table object.

      • numTables

        private int numTables
        Number of tables, which is equal to the size of tables vector.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableManager

        public TableManager()
        Constructs an TableManager object and initialize the attributes tables to empty and numTables to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • getTables

        public Vector<Table> getTables()
        Returns list of tables in Vector data structure
        Returns:
        list of tables in Vector data structure

      • addTable

        public void addTable(int capacity)
        Adds a table to the vector with given capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the intended capacity of table, should be even integer ranging from 2 to 10.

      • getTableById

        public Table getTableById(int id)
        Using table id (table number) to retreive a single Table object from the manager.
        Parameters:
        id - the table id (or table number) to be retreived.
        Returns:
        a Table object of given id.

      • removeTable

        public void removeTable(int id)
        Using table id (table number) to select a table by its id and remove it from the table list (tables)
        Parameters:
        id - table id (table number), positive integer less than or equal to numTables

      • sortTable

        private void sortTable()
        Sorts the entries inside tables by capacity using Collections.sort by implementing Comparable class in Table class and having a compareTo method inside Table class.

      • allocateTable

        public Table allocateTable(int numPerson)
        Returns a Table object that satistifies the number of person and the availability of the table. Returns null if fail to find one.

        Table is first sorted and then iterated through from the least capacity. Next, return the table if and only if the table is available for allocation and number of people that is being allocated (numPeople) is less than the capacity of the table. If no table is returned from the iteration, then null will be returned.

        Parameters:
        numPerson - number of people that is being allocated a table
        Returns:
      • a Table object that satistifies the number of person and the availability of the table.
      • null if fail to find one.
